alert.note: Alert for Ransom (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 17 at 10:24AM CDT until May 24 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota... Sheyenne River at Lisbon affecting Ransom County. .Water levels continue to bounce between moderate and Minor flood stage, but should stabilize soon and drop into the Minor Flood stage before increasing slightly end of the week from more releases on the Baldhill. More rainfall is expected Thursday into Friday which could have a slight impact on the river. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sheyenne River at Lisbon. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 16.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CDT Tuesday was 17.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 17.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall to 16.9 feet and begin rising again tomorrow morning. It will rise to 17.1 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
